page.title: 03THE SOMPTING ESTATE
page.content: Before 1946,the estate comprised{1,200 {ha.}of open downland and scarpfoot lands unploughed for centuries,and raising sheep.Following the "Dig For Victory"campaigns of the two World Wars,the majority of this ancient downland is now ploughed for arable. In 1985,the estate comprises{800 ha.}, of which{140 ha.}produces winter wheat,barley,oats,and spring barley. The remauning{660 ha.}is laid down to short and long term leys,providing fodder for the{80}strong herd of Charolais and Hereford Cross beef cattle. Pre-1946 estate management relied upon horse and man power,9 men and 8 horses.Now the estate employs 25 men and 4 modern tractors.
